## BTree

BTree main class

### Parameters

-   `attr` **(BTreeRootAttrStruct | BTreeValueAttrStruct | [string][65] \| [number][66])** Can be of type object, string, number. In case of object root/value property is expected to be value of root node.

### Examples

```javascript
new BTree(10);
new BTree({ root: 10 });
new BTree({ value: 10 });
```

### root

Root node of the binary tree.

Type: [BTreeNode][67]

### depth

Depth of the binary tree.

Type: [number][66]

### iterator

Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the tree.

#### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
for (const node of tree) {
 console.log(node.value); // 10
}
```

## toString

Returns string value of given tree.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.insert(30);
tree.toString(); // "10102030"
```

## toJSON

Returns JSON Form.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.toJSON(); // {value:10,lNode:{value:20,lNode:null,rNode:null},rNode:null}
```

Returns **BTreeNodeStruct** Returns json form of a given tree.

## toArray

Returns array value.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.toArray(); // [{value:10,...},{value:20,...}]
```

Returns **[Array][68]&lt;[BTreeNode][67]>** Returns array form of given tree.

## insert

Inserts the given value to the tree where first free left child node is found.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** any type of value to be added to tree node.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
tree.insert(10);
tree.insert(20);
tree.insert(30);
tree.toString(); // "10102030"
```

Returns **[BTreeNode][67]** Returns newly created BTreeNode.

## insertLeftMost

Inserts the given value to the tree where first free left child node is found.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** any type of value to be added to tree node.

Returns **[BTreeNode][67]** Returns newly created BTreeNode.

## insertRightMost

Inserts the given value to the tree where first free right child node is found.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** any type of value to be added to tree node.

Returns **[BTreeNode][67]** Returns newly created BTreeNode.

## delete

Deletes given value from tree.
Travarsal = Root -> L -> R.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** Value to be removed.

Returns **[BTreeNode][67]** Returns removed BTreeNode.

## insertAt

Inserts given element at given location. If location is already taken then it does not insert any value.

### Parameters

-   `val` **any** value to insert.
-   `index` **[number][66]** index at which to append new element to.

### Examples

```javascript
tree.insertAt(20,2);
```

-   Throws **any** UnreachableError

## findBFS

Breadth first search. Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in BFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][69]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][70]** 

## recInser

### Parameters

-   `currNode` **[BTreeNode][67]** current node in recursion.
-   `currPath`  

## find

Depth first search, Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in DFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][69]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][70]** 

## recFnc

### Parameters

-   `currNode` **[BTreeNode][67]** Currently processing node.
-   `path` **[Array][68]&lt;(`"U"` \| `"L"` \| `"R"`)>** current path

## each

Depth first search, Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in DFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][69]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][70]** 

## each

Depth first search, Executes given callback functions with parameters BTreeNode and path index for each node in DFS fashion.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][69]** A callback function for execution of each node.

Returns **[undefined][70]** 

## next

Returns **{value: [BTreeNode][67], done: [boolean][71]}** 

## entries

Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the tree.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = new BTree(10);
for (const [index, node] of tree.entries()) {
 console.log(index, node.value); // 0, 10
}
```

Returns **IterableIterator&lt;\[[number][66], [BTreeNode][67]]>** Iterable for iterations.

## map

Maps current tree values to a new tree with modifying the values using given callback function.

### Parameters

-   `callback` **[Function][69]** callback function for value modifier.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var tree2 = tree.map(n => n * 2);
var arr2 = tree2.toArray(); // [{value:20,...},{value:40,...},{value:80,...},{value:60,...}]
```

Returns **[BTree][72]** A new BTree

## getIndexFromPath

Returns index value from given path.

### Parameters

-   `path` **[Array][68]&lt;(`"U"` \| `"L"` \| `"R"`)>** Array for U L or R, which represents the quickest path to get to a node.

Returns **[number][66]** Returns index value.

## getPathFromIndex

Returns Path equivalent to the given index.

### Parameters

-   `index` **[number][66]** Index number from which path to be calculated.

Returns **[Array][68]&lt;(`"U"` \| `"L"` \| `"R"`)>** Path equivalent to the given index.

## fromArray

Converts given values into a Binary Tree.

### Parameters

-   `arr` **any** Any array of values.

### Examples

```javascript
var tree = BTree.fromArray([10,20,30,40]);
```

Returns **[BTree][72]** Newly generated tree.

## BTreeNode

Binary Tree node class, contains 2 child nodes and single value.

### Parameters

-   `attr` **BTreeNodeStruct** attributes to initialize the node. (optional, default `{}`)

### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 15 });
var node3 = new BTreeNode({ value: 30 });
var node2 = new BTreeNode({ value: 20, rNode: node, lNode: node3 });
console.log(node2.lNode.value); // 30
```

### value

Type: any

### lNode

Type: [BTreeNode][67]

### rNode

Type: [BTreeNode][67]

### validate

Validates a BTree node, it must have a valid value (no undefined nor null).

#### Examples

```javascript
new BTreeNode(); // throws error saying `A BTree node must have a valid value, cannot be null or undefined`
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
console.log(node.validate()); // true
```

Returns **[boolean][71]** 

### toJSON

Converts current node and all children nodes in json format.

#### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
var lNode = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: lNode });
console.log(node.toJSON()); // {value:15,lNode: {value: 10,lNode:null,rNode:null},rNode:null}
```

Returns **BTreeNodeStruct** 

### toString

Converts current node and all children nodes in json format and append them together.
Goes in direction of U -> L -> R

#### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
var lNode = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: node });
console.log(node.toString()); // "1015"
```

Returns **[string][65]** 

### getDepth

Returns depth of its children.
Goes in direction of L -> R

#### Examples

```javascript
var node = new BTreeNode({ value: 10 });
var lNode = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: node });
var l2Node = new BTreeNode({ value: 15, lNode: lNode });
console.log(l2Node.getDepth()); // 3
```

Returns **[number][66]**
